children.title: Is this inspection for a hospital?
What type of extinguisher(s) are being inspected?
Status
children.hint: Only deactivate if no longer part of inspection

children.title: Monthly Inspection
children.hint: 7.2.2 Inspection Procedures. Periodic inspection or electronic monitoring of fire extinguishers shall include a check of at least the following items:   (1) Location in designated place   (2) Visibility of the extinguisher or means of indicating the extinguisher location   (3) Access to the extinguisher  (4) Pressure gauge reading or indicator in the operable range or position   (5) Fullness determined by weighing or hefting

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Annual Maintenance
children.hint: 7.3.2.1  An annual external visual examination of all fire extinguishers shall be made to detect obvious physical damage, corrosion, or nozzle blockage to verify that the operating instructions are present, legible, and facing forward, and that the HMIS information is present and legible, and to determine if a 6-year interval examination or hydrostatic test is due.   7.3.2.2 Seals or Tamper Indicators. At the time of the maintenance, the tamper seal of a rechargeable fire extinguisher shall be removed by operating the pull pin or locking device.   7.3.2.2.1 After the applicable maintenance procedures are completed, a new listed tamper seal shall be installed.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Conductivity Test
children.hint: For CO2 only.   7.4 Carbon Dioxide Hose Assembly Conductivity Test. A conductivity test shall be conducted annually on all carbon dioxide hose assemblies.  7.4.1 Carbon dioxide hose assemblies that fail the conductivity test shall be replaced.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Last 12 Year Hydrostatic Test Date
children.hint: If no hydrostatic test has been done due to age of extinguisher, enter manufacture date.

children.title: Last 5 Year Hydrostatic Test Date
children.hint: If no hydrostatic test has been done due to age of extinguisher, enter manufacture date.
children.visible_expr: OR(OR(OR(OR(OR(OR(OR(properties_extinguisher_type = "AFFF/FFFP Foam",properties_extinguisher_type = "Antifreeze"),properties_extinguisher_type = "CO2"),properties_extinguisher_type = "Water"),properties_extinguisher_type = "Water Mist"),properties_extinguisher_type = "Wetting agent"),properties_extinguisher_type = "Alcohol Resistant Foam"),properties_extinguisher_type = "K Class")

children.title: Last 6 Year Test Date
children.hint: If no 6 year maintenance has been done due to age of extinguisher, enter manufacture date.

children.title: Status
children.hint: Only deactivate if no longer part of inspection

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Annual Maintenance
children.hint: 7.3.2.1  An annual external visual examination of all fire extinguishers shall be made to detect obvious physical damage, corrosion, or nozzle blockage to verify that the operating instructions are present, legible, and facing forward, and that the HMIS information is present and legible, and to determine if a 6-year interval examination or hydrostatic test is due.   7.3.2.2  At the time of the maintenance, the tamper seal of a rechargeable fire extinguisher shall be removed by operating the pull pin or locking device.   7.3.2.2.1 After the applicable maintenance procedures are completed, a new listed tamper seal shall be installed.  7.7.1  Discharge hoses on wheeled-type fire extinguishers shall be completely uncoiled and examined for damage annually.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Conductivity Test
children.hint: CO2 Only   7.4 Carbon Dioxide Hose Assembly Conductivity Test. A conductivity test shall be conducted annually on all carbon dioxide hose assemblies.  7.4.1 Carbon dioxide hose assemblies that fail the conductivity test shall be replaced.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Last 6 Year Test Date
children.hint: If no 6 year maintenance has been done due to age of extinguisher, enter manufacture date.
children.visible_expr: OR(OR(OR(OR(properties_extinguisher_type = "ABC - St Press",properties_extinguisher_type = "AFFF/FFFP  St Press"),properties_extinguisher_type = "BC - St Press"),properties_extinguisher_type = "D - St Press"),properties_extinguisher_type = "PK - St Press")

children.title: Last Hydrostatic Test Date
children.hint: If no hydrostatic test has been done due to age of extinguisher, enter manufacture date.

children.title: Gas Cartridge SN

children.title: 12 Hydro Due Date

children.title: The owner and/or designated representative acknowledges the responsibility of the operating condition of the component parts at the time of this inspection. It is agreed that the inspection service provided by the contractor as prescribed herein is limited to performing a visual inspection and/or routine testing, and any investigation or unscheduled testing, modification, maintenance, repair, etc., of the component parts is not included as part of the inspection work performed. It is further understood that all information contained herein is provided to the best of the knowledge of the party providing such information.
